item.title: KSH93 cool features for scripting
item.author: olivier.wulveryck@gmail.com (Olivier Wulveryck)
item.description: From time to time, I’m involved into a trolling conversation when any linux kiddie tells me: Bash is really the superior shell I totally disagree, but as I’m getting older, I don’t argue anymore. Anyway, in this post I will expose two arguments, or I should say two reasons, why I usually use ksh93 to run my scripts. Note I’m really talking about the engine of the script, (the shebang definition).
